intro: Asperella duthiei, commonly known as the Duthie's asperella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the island of Socotra, where it grows in arid and rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. It has a compact growth habit with succulent leaves that help it store water. Asperella duthiei is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its harsh environment.
